quest.name: The Iron Bellows
journal: Iola is filled with gratitude towards you.

According to Iola, the new merchandise you helped develop should allow the Iron Bellows to operate comfortably for the foreseeable future. While the forgemaster considers how best to repay your assistance, she mentions that Eismon was over at the Wandering Stairs and seemed eager to speak with you. Something about a celebration...?

You locate Eismon, and learn that the artisans are indeed planning to celebrate the forge's recent revival. As part of the festivities, they'd hoped to reclaim the ring Iola's father lost, but the moneylender in question is demanding more coin than they could possibly repay. Nee Marn, however, has a proposal involving the creation of another ring, and a dash of Nu Mou mischief. Synthesize an enchanting ring, and deliver it to Eismon's waiting hands.

※In the event you lose the materials or the synthesis ends in failure, you may try again by speaking with Nee Marn's familiar.
You deliver the enchanting ring to Eismon. The time has come to attempt the trade with Walden at Musica Universalis.

With you at his side, Eismon approaches Walden, and offers to trade your crafted ring for Iola's keepsake. The moneylender balks at first, but after seeing the ring's exceptional quality, he soon changes his tune. Eismon returns to the Wandering Stairs, the surprise gift for Iola clutched tightly in his fist.

Once the celebrations are underway, Eismon presents the reclaimed ring to Iola on behalf of his Iron Bellows colleagues. For her part, Iola is overcome with emotion, and embraces her artisans as the family she's long been missing. Speak to the forgemaster in the aftermath of the festivities.

Iola once more expresses her gratitude for your tireless assistance, and assures you that the forge now has enough momentum to continue under its own steam. And if trouble does rear its head, the forgemaster is confident that she can handle it with the help of her three eccentric artisans. Should you ever find yourself missing the peculiar family at the Iron Bellows, Iola urges you to come and pay them a visit.
objectives: Speak to Eismon at the Wandering Stairs.
Synthesize an enchanting ring Deliver the enchanting ring to Eismon.
Speak to Eismon at the Wandering Stairs.
Speak with Iola at the Crystalline Mean.

dialogue.name: IOLA
dialogue.text: After sitting down and tallying up the profit from our various ventures, I'd say we have sufficient funds to keep the Bellows running comfortably for quite some time. Truly, your goods have brought in a small fortune.

dialogue.name: IOLA
dialogue.text: Yet I still haven't thought of a proper way to thank you... While I'm busy with that, why don't you visit with Eismon? He mentioned wanting to have a word with you.

dialogue.name: IOLA
dialogue.text: I've noticed him sneaking about, trying to arrange a celebration with you and our clients, so I'm guessing he needs your help with the preparations.

dialogue.name: IOLA
dialogue.text: Mwahaha! Nothing gets past me! In my forge, I see everything my artisans do...or don't do, for that matter.

dialogue.name: IOLA
dialogue.text: Last I saw, Eismon was over at the Wandering Stairs. Assuming you're of a mind to speak to him...

dialogue.name: EISMON
dialogue.text: Oh, Forename, we've been looking for you. I have a favor to ask you...

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Celebration preparations?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Yes, Iola told me...

dialogue.name: EISMON
dialogue.text: Wait, what!? It was supposed to be a surprise!

dialogue.name: COLANA
dialogue.text: Iola's head might be filled with figures and finances, but she's got a sharp eye. Should I bop her with my hammer so she forgets what we're up to?

dialogue.name: SUEREND
dialogue.text: Someone ought to bop you with a hammer, you uncultured brute.

dialogue.name: SUEREND
dialogue.text: Come now, Eismon, spit it out. Was there not something specific you wished to share concerning the upcoming festivities?

dialogue.name: EISMON
dialogue.text: Oh, yes, of course. Part of our plan was to surprise Iola with a gift─something near and dear to her heart─but we're having trouble, uh, acquiring the item in question.

dialogue.name: COLANA
dialogue.text: He's talking about the ring Iola's father lost to that bastard moneylender. The three of us have been working our fingers to the bone this past while, scrimping and saving what we could, all so we'd have the coin to buy it back.

dialogue.name: SUEREND
dialogue.text: Once we'd deemed our purse sufficiently hefty, we paid a visit to this nefarious usurer─a shifty fellow by the name of “Walden.”

dialogue.name: SUEREND
dialogue.text: Yet even after we paid the villain his due, he refused to surrender the ring. Apparently we'd failed to account for the “interest” accrued in the intervening years. A patently absurd amount...

dialogue.name: EISMON
dialogue.text: We're at a loss as to what to do next. I was hoping someone as well traveled as you might have some advice to give.

dialogue.name: NEEMARN
dialogue.text: Am I too early? I'm too early. <snort> I don't get invited to a lot of parties with people...

dialogue.name: NEEMARN
dialogue.text: ...You seem troubled. Is there a problem with the celebrations?

dialogue.name: NEEMARN
dialogue.text: So you paid this man a fair price, but he did not honor the trade? Demanded more from you?

dialogue.name: NEEMARN
dialogue.text: We of the Nu Mou frown upon deals where the balance of value swings too far in one side's favor. <snort> This Walden fellow sounds in need of a lesson in equilibrium...

dialogue.name: COLANA
dialogue.text: Oh, I'd love to teach him a lesson, but the only one I can think of is like to leave me covered in blood and arrested by the guard...

dialogue.name: SUEREND
dialogue.text: Let us not attempt anything rash─'twould only add to Iola's woes. Still, I'm afraid a civilized approach has already failed to persuade that unmannered churl to part with the ring.

dialogue.name: NEEMARN
dialogue.text: <snort> No violence will be necessary, my friends. I have an idea.

dialogue.name: NEEMARN
dialogue.text: This is your moment to shine, Forename. I'm going to supply you with some materials─use them to make a ring of finest quality, then give it to Eismon.

dialogue.name: NEEMARN
dialogue.text: I realize this is all very mysterious, but I ask that you trust me. Everything will be explained soon enough.

dialogue.name: IOLA
dialogue.text: Did you catch up with Eismon? He was headed to the Wandering Stairs, last I heard.

dialogue.name: COLANA
dialogue.text: What a bloody mess...

dialogue.name: SUEREND
dialogue.text: Confound it all...

dialogue.name: EISMON
dialogue.text: I'll just...stand around here. Until the ring is ready.

dialogue.name: EISMON
dialogue.text: Oh, well that didn't take near as long as I thought it would. That's beautiful work, Forename.

dialogue.name: EISMON
dialogue.text: So, Nee Marn... What exactly is the plan for this ring?

dialogue.name: NEEMARN
dialogue.text: The materials I provided to Forename were prepared with a minor enchantment. Walden will be so taken with our ring that he'll be willing to offer Iola's ring in trade.

dialogue.name: COLANA
dialogue.text: What, just like that?

dialogue.name: SUEREND
dialogue.text: I have doubts as well, but I say we give it a try.

dialogue.name: EISMON
dialogue.text: Right, then, let's pay another visit to Walden. Will you come along, Forename? He should be lurking around Musica Universalis.

dialogue.name: IOLA
dialogue.text: Did you meet with Eismon?

dialogue.name: NEEMARN
dialogue.text: Did you run into difficulties forging the ring? Not to worry, I have some materials in reserve...

dialogue.name: NEEMARN
dialogue.text: A ring, a ring, a wondrous thing, when its metal band hides a Nu Mou's sting!♪

dialogue.name: COLANA
dialogue.text: I don't know what's going on, but I'm keeping a hammer handy. Just in case.

dialogue.name: SUEREND
dialogue.text: We can but trust in the Nu Mou's sense of fairness. I am curious as to what mischief the flying pig has in mind...

dialogue.name: WALDEN
dialogue.text: Eh? Back so soon?

dialogue.name: EISMON
dialogue.text: We came for the ring, Walden. We already paid you a fair price for its return.

dialogue.name: WALDEN
dialogue.text: Let me spell it out for you again, boy: no money, no ring. You'll get naught but curses till you cough up the interest what's owed me!

dialogue.name: EISMON
dialogue.text: We don't have that kind of money, but we do have another ring you might be interested in. Care to trade?

dialogue.name: WALDEN
dialogue.text: Trade!? Do I look like a flea market to you!? I only deal in cold, hard coin!

dialogue.name: EISMON
dialogue.text: Oh? Maybe you should inspect the quality of the goods before you make up your mind. Here, see how it glitters?

dialogue.name: WALDEN
dialogue.text: W-Well, ain't that a pretty little thing! I had no idea such beauty still existed in this world. It's just so...precious!

dialogue.name: EISMON
dialogue.text: I had a feeling you would appreciate the, uh, the craftsmanship.

dialogue.name: WALDEN
dialogue.text: Aye, it ain't often I get me hands on a proper treasure like this one... You've got yourself a deal, boy. Here, take your bleedin' ring─go on, take it!

dialogue.name: EISMON
dialogue.text: A pleasure doing business with you.

dialogue.name: WALDEN
dialogue.text: Hee hee! Enjoy your worthless old antique. There's only one ring I care about now!

dialogue.name: EISMON
dialogue.text: The way his eyes lit up was almost disturbing. Just what kind of spell did Nee Marn weave into those materials...?

dialogue.name: EISMON
dialogue.text: Well, we'd best be getting back to the others. The festivities aren't going to prepare themselves.

dialogue.name: NEEMARN
dialogue.text: You've made the ring, exactly as I asked. Just be sure Walden sees it, and everything will turn out for the best. I promise you.

dialogue.name: EISMON
dialogue.text: Aye, that's Walden. I really hate the part where he yells at me. I could do without the yelling...

dialogue.name: EISMON
dialogue.text: A strange business, that, but at least we have the ring Iola wanted. Now we can celebrate without a care!

dialogue.name: EISMON
dialogue.text: ...Although we should probably finish up the preparations before the guests arrive.

dialogue.name: EISMON
dialogue.text: Ahem. Iola, we have a gift for you.

dialogue.name: IOLA
dialogue.text: Oooh, a gift! Is it flowers? Some sweet treat from the markets?

dialogue.name: COLANA
dialogue.text: Hah! As if you'd want something as pointless as that!

dialogue.name: SUEREND
dialogue.text: ...Indeed.

dialogue.name: IOLA
dialogue.text: Ahahaha! Aye, I'd rather a sack of coins than some smelly bouquet!

dialogue.name: EISMON
dialogue.text: Not a sack of coins, I'm afraid...but it is a precious metal.

dialogue.name: IOLA
dialogue.text: Oh, Eismon, are you proposing? I know I'm pretty for a smithy, but this is all too sudden...

dialogue.name: IOLA
dialogue.text: ...Just a damn moment. Th-That's my father's ring! Where...? How!?

dialogue.name: COLANA
dialogue.text: We weren't able to stand by you when the Bellows needed us most, so we got back the thing you most wanted instead.

dialogue.name: SUEREND
dialogue.text: Fittingly, your efforts to revive the forge were the reason we could earn enough money to buy that trinket back in the first place─that, and a dash of Forename's exceptional craftsmanship.

dialogue.name: IOLA
dialogue.text: I don't know what to say except...thank you. I'd thought myself alone since my father died, but it seems I do have family around me after all.

dialogue.name: NEEMARN
dialogue.text: <snort> And now we see the girl behind the forgemaster's mask. A bittersweet day.

dialogue.name: EISMON
dialogue.text: It's certainly been an interesting one. Speaking of which, you never did tell us what kind of enchantment you put on the moneylender's new ring. He all but snatched it out of my hand...

dialogue.name: NEEMARN
dialogue.text: Ah, that was naught magical─his desire for the ring was born entirely of mundane greed. I knew that an avaricious wretch such as Walden would soon see the value of Forename's craft.

dialogue.name: NEEMARN
dialogue.text: My contribution was far less innocuous─a little curse of misfortune, to punish his unfair weighting of the scales. That man's financial luck is about to take a decidedly ugly turn for the worse.

dialogue.name: NEEMARN
dialogue.text: You needn't look so worried─I would never weave curses upon an upstanding trading partner such as you. Keep the balance, and all will be well between us.

dialogue.name: NEEMARN
dialogue.text: Your efforts were successful, yes?

dialogue.name: COLANA
dialogue.text: Huh, you got the ring back. I don't put much stock in wispy magicks you can't even see, but they seemed to have worked on Walden.

dialogue.name: SUEREND
dialogue.text: I only hope that winning the ring back counts for something against the balance I owe Iola's family.

dialogue.name: IOLA
dialogue.text: It's good to see you, Forename. All that excitement has left me feeling positively drained.

dialogue.name: EISMON
dialogue.text: All that proper food has left me feeling unusually full.

dialogue.name: COLANA
dialogue.text: Ugh, well I feel like someone's been using my head for an anvil. Don't remember much after that tenth tankard...

dialogue.name: SUEREND
dialogue.text: Shall I remind you, then? In your inebriation, you deemed it necessary to initiate a brawl with our Zun guest. The tavernkeep will be sending a bill for the destruction you caused to his establishment.

dialogue.name: IOLA
dialogue.text: You might have stopped her instead of making wagers on the outcome, Rend. Tell me why I rehired you people again?

dialogue.name: IOLA
dialogue.text: ...I suppose the answer to that is right in front of me. I still can't believe you managed to prise it from Walden's grubby hands.

dialogue.name: EISMON
dialogue.text: We couldn't have done it without Forename and Nee Marn.

dialogue.name: IOLA
dialogue.text: Aye, thank you again, Forename. You've been there for me every step of the way.

dialogue.name: IOLA
dialogue.text: From here on in, I think I can keep the Bellows running under its own steam. And if there's any trouble, I have these three miscreants to help me deal with it.

dialogue.name: IOLA
dialogue.text: You've left us in a good place, Forename, but know you're welcome to come and visit any time you like.

dialogue.name: IOLA
dialogue.text: And don't forget to take your payment─you've certainly earned it!

dialogue.name: COLANA
dialogue.text: Head, pounding... Belly, churning... No, dinnerbreakfastlunch, stay down!

dialogue.name: SUEREND
dialogue.text: Colana can cover a disgustingly large area with her putrid retching. Thankfully, I always have several changes of clothes on hand...

dialogue.name: EISMON
dialogue.text: I don't think I've ever seen Iola cry before...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Iola is ecstatic over your efforts. She now considers you the Iron Bellows' Savior!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: There may be other folk in the Crystalline Mean who could use the assistance of a talented artisan. Ask around, and see who is in need of your skills.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You have completed all the deliveries currently available. When you have a spare moment, it seems Katliss would like to have a word with you.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Return to visit the Crystalline Mean once you have completed the Shadowbringers main scenario.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You have completed all the deliveries currently available. When you have a spare moment, it seems Katliss would like to have a word with you.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Visit her at the main reception counter in the Crystalline Mean.
